content.title: ARDS Management
content.summary: Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome (ARDS) is characterized by acute hypoxemic respiratory failure with bilateral pulmonary infiltrates not fully explained by cardiac failure. Management centers on lung-protective ventilation, prone positioning for severe ARDS, conservative fluid strategy, and treatment of the underlying cause. ARDS has 30-40% mortality.
key_points: Berlin Definition: Acute onset, bilateral infiltrates, P/F ratio ≤300, not explained by heart failure
Lung-protective ventilation: Low tidal volume (6 mL/kg IBW), plateau pressure ≤30 cmH2O
PEEP titration to optimize oxygenation while avoiding overdistension
Prone positioning for 12-16 hours/day if P/F <150 (PROSEVA trial)
Conservative fluid management (FACTT trial) once shock resolved
Neuromuscular blockade for severe ARDS (first 48h) - ACURASYS, less clear after ROSE
content.statement: ARDS management prioritizes lung-protective ventilation with low tidal volumes and adequate PEEP, prone positioning for moderate-severe disease, conservative fluid balance, and treatment of the underlying cause.

explanation.intuition: ARDS lungs are 'baby lungs' - only a small portion is available for gas exchange. Using normal tidal volumes overdistends these areas, causing ventilator-induced lung injury. Low TV (6 mL/kg) and adequate PEEP keep healthy lung open without damaging it.
explanation.key_insight: ARDSNet trial showed 9% absolute mortality reduction with low TV (6 vs 12 mL/kg). PROSEVA showed 16% absolute mortality reduction with early prone positioning in severe ARDS. These are the highest-impact interventions.
explanation.technical_details: Calculate IBW: Males = 50 + 2.3(height in inches - 60); Females = 45.5 + 2.3(height in inches - 60). Target TV 6 mL/kg IBW. Allow permissive hypercapnia if needed. Driving pressure (Pplat - PEEP) <15 cmH2O may be best predictor of outcomes.

definitions_glossary.ARDS: Acute respiratory distress syndrome; inflammatory lung injury causing hypoxemic respiratory failure
definitions_glossary.Berlin_definition: 2012 criteria for ARDS diagnosis and severity classification
definitions_glossary.lung_protective_ventilation: Low TV (6 mL/kg IBW), Pplat ≤30, adequate PEEP
definitions_glossary.PEEP: Positive end-expiratory pressure; maintains alveolar recruitment
definitions_glossary.prone_positioning: Placing patient face-down to improve V/Q matching and oxygenation
definitions_glossary.driving_pressure: Plateau pressure minus PEEP; represents stress on functional lung
definitions_glossary.plateau_pressure: Airway pressure during inspiratory hold; reflects alveolar pressure
definitions_glossary.permissive_hypercapnia: Allowing elevated CO2 to avoid injurious ventilator settings
definitions_glossary.neuromuscular_blockade: Paralysis to improve ventilator synchrony; ACURASYS/ROSE trials
definitions_glossary.recruitment_maneuver: Transient high PEEP to open collapsed alveoli
definitions_glossary.ECMO: Extracorporeal membrane oxygenation for refractory hypoxemia

pathophysiology.mechanism: Inflammatory injury → alveolar-capillary barrier disruption → protein-rich pulmonary edema → surfactant dysfunction → atelectasis → V/Q mismatch → refractory hypoxemia

Berlin_definition.timing: Within 1 week of known insult or new/worsening symptoms
Berlin_definition.imaging: Bilateral opacities on CXR/CT not explained by effusions, atelectasis, or nodules
Berlin_definition.origin: Not fully explained by cardiac failure or fluid overload

lung_protective_ventilation.PEEP: Use ARDSNet PEEP/FiO2 tables or best compliance approach

prone_positioning.contraindications: Spinal instability, open abdomen, elevated ICP

conservative_fluid_management.target: Even to negative fluid balance (FACTT trial)

adjuncts.neuromuscular_blockade: Consider first 48h in severe ARDS (controversial after ROSE)

definition.@value: Evidence-based management of ARDS including lung-protective ventilation, prone positioning, and conservative fluid strategy

learning_objectives: Apply Berlin criteria to diagnose and classify ARDS severity
Calculate ideal body weight and set lung-protective ventilator settings
clinical_pearls: Use IBW not actual weight for TV calculation
Prone early and long (16h) in severe ARDS - saves lives (PROSEVA)
Driving pressure <15 may be most important parameter
Treat the cause - ARDS management is supportive
